heading: green card
subheading: it won't turn to dust when you reach your limit, but greenpeace has unveiled a biodegradable credit card. the greenpeace mastercard, to be issued by household bank, is made with a plant-based polymer. statements and other mailings will still kill trees but won't contain dioxin given off by chlorine used in some paper manufacturing processes. greenpeace has challenged us financial services firms to follow suit with their cards and stop using vinyl, "the poison plastic."
author: wired staff
